entry.title: Re: Flexible Stock Selection for Delivery – Q Stock or Un...
entry.content:
Hello @Haily 

It is correct for Strategy Group E2 to enforce a link to a WBS element, causing MRP and ATP to always source from project stock (Q stock) instead of unrestricted stock.

However, it’s important to clarify that stock determination (OMSL/OBBC) cannot be used to switch between project stock and unrestricted stock. Stock determination only applies across categories such as unrestricted, quality inspection, and blocked stock, but project stock is managed as special stock and is excluded from this logic.

If the business needs flexibility to ship the same material either from project stock or from unrestricted stock, this must be managed during sales order creation rather than at delivery. The standard method is to use different requirement types or sales order types.:

  • Project-related orders (linked to WBS) will consume Q stock.
  • Standard orders (no WBS) will consume unrestricted stock.

This approach allows the same material to be shipped from either stock type, with the decision made during order creation rather than at delivery.

With kind regards

Chuma

GenAI Assist content. SAP Document References:

  • SAP Help Portal – Project Stock in Sales and Distribution
  • Physical Inventory Process-SAP Help

entry.title: Re: 請問有API可以讓外部系統查詢[自動科目決定]嗎?
entry.content:
Hello @Fang 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, there are no traditional SAP GUI transaction codes tcodes. All activities are conducted using Fiori apps, each identified by an App ID.

There are no tcodes when transitioning from ECC or S/4HANA on-premise, so SAP offers cross-references in the Fiori Apps Reference Library. This simplifies the process of matching familiar tcodes to their Fiori counterparts.

A few examples from Finance:

  • FB50 (Post G/L Document) → Post Journal Entries -App ID F0718
  • FB03 (Display Document) → Display Journal Entries-App ID F7697
  • F110 (Automatic Payments) → Manage Automatic Payments -APP ID F0770
  • OBYC (MM Account Determination) → done via Manage Your Solution → Configure Your Solution using SSCUIs

For configuration activities like OBYC, there isn’t a direct tcodes replacement; instead, it’s handled in guided configuration steps (SSCUI).

No codes are in Public Cloud; instead, there are Fiori apps and SSCUIs, with mapping references available to bridge the gap.

Hope it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: F2582 Team Utilization and Workers Management Hierarchy
entry.content:
Hello @RogerEarle 

Thank you for the question

The Current system Behaviour

  • The Team Utilisation app (F2582) shows only direct reports for each manager.
  • It relies on data from the Manage Workforce app (F0770).
  • If a worker, Carlos Sainz, reports to a manager, Janice Short, who in turn reports to a higher manager, David Jones, only Janice appears as David’s direct report. Carlos does not show up for David, only for Janice.
  • Indirect relationships are not automatically displayed. This is how the app is designed and is not a configurable setting.

The course of the error

The utilization app does not assess multiple levels of reporting hierarchy. This is the current standard behaviour, not a configuration issue.

Possible solution

Change Reporting Structure

    • Assign indirect workers like Carlos directly to higher-level managers like David in the workforce hierarchy.
    • This allows David to see and manage Carlos

Hope it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Clear Salary outside HireDate and TerminationDate ran...
entry.content:
Hello @dhanush9 

You’re correct, using FOREACH in Data Actions tends to be quite slow and isn't suitable for larger datasets, which accounts for the long runtime you experienced.

Also, your editor errors are correct:

  • var and ISNULL belong to Analytic Application scripting (JavaScript).
  • In Data Action Language (DAL), you should instead use:
    • DEFINE to declare variables,
    • IF…ELSE or CASE expressions for null/conditional logic.

My earlier example didn’t run in your DAL script. Let me know If you need further support or would like to share the exact transformation 

With kind regards

Chuma

I believe the current error is because DATEDIFF is considering all the values from Date dimensions range, is there a way I can limit them?

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Error message while confirming a repair order in SAP...
entry.content:
Hello @belaiche 

Error item 10: A record transferred on 02/28/2025 lacks a personnel number, indicating that the user confirming the repair order is not associated with an employee record containing a valid personnel number. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, confirmations for service or repair orders always require this employee association.

Please check the following;

Maintain Employee Master Data

    • Go to the Manage Workforce or Maintain Employees app.
    • Make sure the person performing the confirmation exists as an employee and has a valid personnel number.

Assign Business User to Employee

    • In the same app, confirm that the Business User ID is assigned to the employee record.
    • Without this link, the system cannot derive the personnel number during order confirmation.

Organizational Assignment

    • Make sure the employee is assigned to the correct organisational unit, for example, the service org or plant relevant to the repair order.

If you find that the employee record is missing, go ahead and create it. If you notice that it exists but is missing some details, such as the business user link, simply update the record to fill in the gaps. This way, everything stays current and complete.

Once the business user is properly linked to an employee with a personnel number, the repair order confirmation should work without errors.

Hope it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

 

GenAI Assisted Content

SAP Document references

  • SAP Help – Manage Workforce
  • KBA 2646803 - How to Maintain Workforce Person Data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: ABAP
entry.content: Hello

entry.title: Re: Flexible Stock Selection for Delivery – Q Stock or Unrestricted Stock
entry.content: That’s a really good question 👍 It sounds like your setup is currently forcing everything into project stock once you use the WBS link, which limits flexibility. In many cases, whether you can ship from Q stock or unrestricted stock comes down to how the sales order is structured and the storage location assignment. You may want to look into separating the process with different storage locations or using availability check rules that distinguish between Q and unrestricted stock. It might also be worth asking your functional consultant if a user exit or configuration tweak could allow the system to let you pick at delivery time instead of forcing one path. This is definitely a scenario that pops up when businesses need both options for the same material. Would you like me to suggest some possible SAP config paths that others have used for similar setups?

We have both kind of systems, ECC and S4
Thank you

entry.title: Re: Manufacturer in Material Master
entry.content:
Hello @Dinesh_158 

Yes, you can use the Manufacturer field in the material master to record the actual manufacturer or brand, even if you are purchasing the material through a dealer. This field is separate from the supplier/vendor master and is meant for capturing the real manufacturer information.

If you need to store a unique brand name distinct from the manufacturer and report on it, the recommended approach in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is to use Classification with a custom characteristic for Brand, or you can create a custom field via In-App Extensibility and expose it in reporting through a custom CDS view 

You can check the SAP Help documentation for Material Master in S/4HANA Cloud here:
SAP Help – Material Master Data

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to connect SAP Planon with S4HANA Public cloud wi...
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 

You can connect Planon with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition via SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) on SAP BTP. Planon offers the REM4SAP app, which synchronises master data like business partners, cost centres, and rentable units. with S/4HANA Cloud using the One Domain Model.

Follow steps below.

Activate MDI service in SAP BTP.

Configure the Planon REM4SAP app (system URL, client ID, token).

Register S/4HANA Cloud in MDI and map the master data objects.

Use standard Planon-to-SAP mappings; transactional data flows use iFlows, not MDI.

SAP Document References

  • SAP Help – Integration with Planon Real Estate Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Planon REM4SAP Documentation

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: System downtime message from SM02 on Fiori launchpad
entry.content:
When the system experiences downtime for a specific period, it is important to notify users promptly. In SAP GUI, system-wide announcements or maintenance notifications are broadcast using transaction code SM02. However, the Fiori Launchpad, built for a modern user experience, does not automatically display SM02 messages as popups or notifications.

To address this gap, the following blog explains how to create a custom plugin that enables downtime messages to be displayed on the Fiori Launchpad.

 

You should start by creating a new BAS project using the standard project generators for a freestyle application. To do this follow the next steps:

  1. Launch BAS. Once loaded, go to File >> New Project from Template.

 

2. Select SAP Fiori Application generator and click on Start

 

3. Select SAPUI5 freestyle from application type dropdown, followed by selecting the SAPUI5 Application generator and clicking on Next.

 

4. If you want to show hardcoded data on Popup then Select Data source = None and click on Next.

 

5. Otherwise, If you want to show message via any backend service or message present in  SM02 transaction then Select 

Data source = Connect to System

System = <Give Your system name>

Service <Select desired service url>

and click on Next.

 

 

 

6. Use default value for field View name and click on Next.

7. Enter the following details and click on Finish:

Parameter

Value

Module Name:

< Your plugin module name > (for example: zflp.systdowntime.plugin)

Application Title:

< Your plugin title > (for example: System downtime message Plugin on Launchpad)

Application Namespace:

< Your plugin namespace > (for example: com.plugin)

Description:

< Your plugin description > (for example: SAP Fiori Launchpad Plugin)

Project folder path:

< Your project root folder in BAS > (for example: /home/user/projects)

Minimum SAPUI5 version:

< Your backend system SAPUI5 library version > (for example: 1.84.14)

Add deployment Configuration:

No

Add FLP configuration

No

Configure advanced options

No

8. In our case, we need to create an SAP Fiori Launchpad plugin. Since controllers, views, and routers are not required for this plugin, we should delete the corresponding folders and their contents. To do this, right-click the folder and select Delete Permanently from the context menu.

 

9. With all files and folder deleted, your project should only contain the i18n folder, component.js and manifest.json files.

 

NOTE - As we have modified the project structure and deleted test files, you will not be able to test the plugin from BAS, you would need to deploy the plugin to the on-premise system for testing. Plugin deployment is explained in the following sections.

10. Open the manifest.json file in your project and take note of the value of the ID parameter. 

 

 

11. Do the below changes into Manifest file.

 

12. Sample Manifest code:

{

  "_version": "1.28.0",

  "sap.app": {

    "id": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin",

    "type": "component",

    "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties",

    "applicationVersion": {

      "version": "0.0.1"

    },

    "title": "{{appTitle}}",

    "description": "{{appDescription}}",

    "resources": "resources.json",

    "sourceTemplate": {

      "id": "@sap/generator-fiori:basic",

      "version": "1.18.4",

      "toolsId": "d7c0a4d1-7ec4-4765-a65f-ef409eb221aa"

    },

    "dataSources": {

      "mainService": {

        "uri": "/sap/opu/odata/iwbep/Backend_Messages/",

        "type": "OData",

        "settings": {

          "annotations": [],

          "localUri": "localService/mainService/metadata.xml",

          "odataVersion": "2.0"

        }

      }

    }

  },

    "sap.flp": {

      "type": "plugin"

    },

  "sap.ui": {

    "technology": "UI5",

    "icons": {

      "icon": "",

      "favIcon": "",

      "phone": "",

      "phone@2": "",

      "tablet": "",

      "tablet@2": ""

    },

    "deviceTypes": {

      "desktop": true,

      "tablet": true,

      "phone": true

    }

  },

  "sap.ui5": {

    "flexEnabled": true,

    "dependencies": {

      "minUI5Version": "1.84.14",

      "libs": {

        "sap.m": {},

        "sap.ui.core": {}

      }

    },

    "contentDensities": {

      "compact": true,

      "cozy": true

    },

    "models": {

      "i18n": {

        "type": "sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel",

        "settings": {

          "bundleName": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.i18n.i18n"

        }

      },

      "": {

        "dataSource": "mainService",

        "preload": true,

        "settings": {}

      }

    },

    "resources": {

      "css": [

        {

          "uri": "css/style.css"

        }

      ]

    },

    "routing": {

      "config": {

        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",

        "viewType": "XML",

        "async": true,

        "viewPath": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.view",

        "controlAggregation": "pages",

        "controlId": "app",

        "clearControlAggregation": false

      },

      "routes": [

        {

          "name": "RouteView1",

          "pattern": ":?query:",

          "target": [

            "TargetView1"

          ]

        }

      ],

      "targets": {

        "TargetView1": {

          "viewType": "XML",

          "transition": "slide",

          "clearControlAggregation": false,

          "viewId": "View1",

          "viewName": "View1"

        }

      }

    },

    "rootView": {

      "viewName": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.view.App",

      "type": "XML",

      "async": true,

      "id": "App"

    }

  }

}

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

NOTE - Plugins do not require additional definitions, this would be the simplest version of a manifest.json file and the base for creating an FLP plugin.

13.  Copy below sample code into your code.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sample Component code :

{

  "_version": "1.28.0",

  "sap.app": {

    "id": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin",

    "type": "component",

    "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties",

    "applicationVersion": {

      "version": "0.0.1"

    },

    "title": "{{appTitle}}",

    "description": "{{appDescription}}",

    "resources": "resources.json",

    "sourceTemplate": {

      "id": "@sap/generator-fiori:basic",

      "version": "1.18.4",

      "toolsId": "d7c0a4d1-7ec4-4765-a65f-ef409eb221aa"

    },

    "dataSources": {

      "mainService": {

        "uri": "/sap/opu/odata/iwbep/Backend_Messages/",

        "type": "OData",

        "settings": {

          "annotations": [],

          "localUri": "localService/mainService/metadata.xml",

          "odataVersion": "2.0"

        }

      }

    }

  },

    "sap.flp": {

      "type": "plugin"

    },

  "sap.ui": {

    "technology": "UI5",

    "icons": {

      "icon": "",

      "favIcon": "",

      "phone": "",

      "phone@2": "",

      "tablet": "",

      "tablet@2": ""

    },

    "deviceTypes": {

      "desktop": true,

      "tablet": true,

      "phone": true

    }

  },

  "sap.ui5": {

    "flexEnabled": true,

    "dependencies": {

      "minUI5Version": "1.84.14",

      "libs": {

        "sap.m": {},

        "sap.ui.core": {}

      }

    },

    "contentDensities": {

      "compact": true,

      "cozy": true

    },

    "models": {

      "i18n": {

        "type": "sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel",

        "settings": {

          "bundleName": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.i18n.i18n"

        }

      },

      "": {

        "dataSource": "mainService",

        "preload": true,

        "settings": {}

      }

    },

    "resources": {

      "css": [

        {

          "uri": "css/style.css"

        }

      ]

    },

    "routing": {

      "config": {

        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",

        "viewType": "XML",

        "async": true,

        "viewPath": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.view",

        "controlAggregation": "pages",

        "controlId": "app",

        "clearControlAggregation": false

      },

      "routes": [

        {

          "name": "RouteView1",

          "pattern": ":?query:",

          "target": [

            "TargetView1"

          ]

        }

      ],

      "targets": {

        "TargetView1": {

          "viewType": "XML",

          "transition": "slide",

          "clearControlAggregation": false,

          "viewId": "View1",

          "viewName": "View1"

        }

      }

    },

    "rootView": {

      "viewName": "com.plugin.zflp.systdowntime.plugin.view.App",

      "type": "XML",

      "async": true,

      "id": "App"

    }

  }

}

 

 

 

 

 

Deploy your Plugin to your SAP S/4HANA backend system.

14.  Once you have adjusted the code you would need to deploy your code to On prem system.

15.  Right-click on your project name (for example: zflp.systdowntime.plugin) and from the menu, select option Open in         Integrated Terminal.

16.  From the terminal, run command npm run deploy-config

  • Select Target : ABAP
  • Select your backend destination and press Enter.
  • Define a name for the ICF node that will be created on deployment (for example: ZFLPLUGINPOPUP) and press Enter.
  • Enter a description to your ICF node (for example: Plugin for setting FLP Title) and press Enter.
  • Enter the name of the plugin package you created earlier (for example: ZFIORI_PLUGIN) and press Enter.
  • Enter a transport request (manually, choose from existing or create a new transport request)

17.  Wait for the process to conclude.

 

18.  From the terminal, run command npm run deploy, review your deployment setting and enter YES to continue (press Enter). Wait for the process to conclude.

 

19.  Go to SICF Tcode and note down the Url .

 

20.  Now we must activate your SAP Fiori Launchpad Plugin created above. To do that login to your system in GUI or WebGUI through FLP and run transaction: /N/UI2/FLP_CONF_DEF.

21.  Accept all dialog messages, double-click on section Define Launchpad Plug-ins followed by clicking on button New Entries. Enter the following details and Save (you will be prompted for a transport request):

 

22.  Run transaction: /N/UI2/FLP_SYS_CONF

23.  Accept all dialog messages, double-click on section “Launchpad Plug-ins” section followed by clicking on button New Entries

24.  select your recently created plugin configuration (In step number 21)  and then click on Save.

25.  Once you activate your plugin it will automatically appear on your launchpad. In my case I am showing Message box. Once Launchpad is loaded our popup message will appear there.

entry.title: Re: Backflush Not Working in SAP Public Cloud + DM Integr...
entry.content:
Hello @Suresh-Eswaran 

Thanks for sharing the detailed screenshots. Based on what you’ve shown, the routing setup all components flagged for backflush under activity 0390  and the production order Backflush; visible in Manage Order appear to be correct.

Here are a few extra checks that are often needed

Material Master

    • In the Work Scheduling view of the material master, make sure that the Backflush indicator is also selected. If it is not configured at the material level, the system may disregard the routing and order settings.

SAP Learning – Work Scheduling Data in Material Master.

Control Key for the Operation

    • Verify the control key assigned to activity 0390. It should permit backflushing; if the control key lacks this flag, the system will not activate it.t.

Confirmation Parameters

    • Review the confirmation profile in use. Ensure that automatic goods issue (backflush) is enabled in the parameters.

Storage Location and Stock

    • Make sure that a valid storage location is assigned in the component data and that there is sufficient stock. Missing stock or a storage location can also prevent the backflush posting.

Overall, the routing and order setup are fine, but backflushing also depends on the material master, control key, and confirmation parameters. It is recommended to check these areas to resolve the issue.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Business AI – Driving the Next Wave of Enterprise Innovation
entry.content:
Why It Matters

AI is no longer a distant concept—it’s transforming how businesses operate today. Generative AI alone is projected to add up to $4.4 trillion in global productivity within the next five years. For SAP customers, who generate 87% of the world’s commerce, the impact of embedding AI directly into core business processes is both immediate and profound.

Key Highlights:

Joule – The AI Copilot

  • Acts as SAP’s unified front end, enabling users to work in natural language.

  • Delivers context-aware insights, transaction execution, and navigation across SAP apps.

  • Boosts efficiency by up to 80% for employees.

  • Coordinates specialized AI agents for complex tasks (e.g., dispute resolution, sustainability planning).

  • Integrates with Microsoft Copilot for Office 365 for seamless cross-platform experiences.

Embedded AI – Innovation at Scale

  • AI features are built directly into SAP’s cloud solutions (ERP, Supply Chain, HCM, CRM, Procurement, etc.).

  • Use cases already improving business outcomes:

    • Henkel → Faster, data-driven decisions with AI in SAP Analytics Cloud.

    • FC Bayern Munich → Accelerated recruiting with generative AI in SAP SuccessFactors.

    • Gibson → Boosted email revenue by 50% through AI-powered customer engagement.

  • Over 100+ new AI features released in 2024, with continuous quarterly rollouts.

AI Foundation – Building Custom Solutions

  • Part of SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).

  • Provides developers with reusable AI services, lifecycle management, and access to leading LLMs (OpenAI, Google, AWS, Meta, etc.).

  • Offers deep integration with SAP HANA Cloud Vector Engine and SAP Knowledge Graph for contextualized business data.

  • Enables low-data AI innovation, such as invoice due date predictions or sales order auto-filling .

Responsible AI at SAP

  • Commitment to ethics, privacy, and security:

    • No partner or third-party models are trained on customer data.

    • AI ethics embedded in governance via SAP’s AI Ethics Steering Committee.

    • Guardrails against misuse, bias, and security risks.

  • Alignment with UNESCO AI ethics standards and EU AI Act compliance .

SAP’s vision is AI-first and suite-first:

  • AI copilots like Joule will become hyper-personalized.

  • More AI-driven automation across finance, HR, supply chain, and sustainability.

The future is already here. With SAP Business AI, organizations can run better, innovate faster, and empower people to focus on what truly matters.

Explore more:

  • SAP Business AI Feature Catalog

  • Learning Journeys

entry.title: Re: SAP Business AI – Driving the Next Wave of Enterprise...
entry.content: Thank you, moved it blogs section

entry.title: Re: Clear Salary outside HireDate and TerminationDate ran...
entry.content:
Hello @dhanush9 

Please try below ,If your dates are measured


// Scope narrowly
MEMBERSET [d/Version] = "public.Plan"
MEMBERSET [d/Entity] = "ENT_001","ENT_002"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = BETWEEN("2024.01","2025.12")
MEMBERSET [d/Account] = "START_DATE","END_DATE","DAYS"

// Only where both dates exist; pin all other dims with #
WHEN NOT ISNULL(RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account]="START_DATE"))
AND NOT ISNULL(RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account]="END_DATE"))

DATA([d/Account]="DAYS") =
DATEDIFF(
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account]="START_DATE", [d/Product]=#, [d/Project]=#, [d/Customer]=#),
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account]="END_DATE" , [d/Product]=#, [d/Project]=#, [d/Customer]=#),
"DAY"
);

ENDWHEN

If your dates are dimension properties (attributes)

MEMBERSET [d/Version] = "public.Plan"
MEMBERSET [d/Entity] = "ENT_001","ENT_002"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = BETWEEN("2024.01","2025.12")
MEMBERSET [d/Account] = "DAYS"

VAR vStart = DIMPROPERTY([d/Project]=#, "START_DATE_PROP");
VAR vEnd = DIMPROPERTY([d/Project]=#, "END_DATE_PROP");

WHEN NOT ISNULL(vStart) AND NOT ISNULL(vEnd)
DATA([d/Account]="DAYS") = DATEDIFF(vStart, vEnd, "DAY");
ENDWHEN

Above;

Scoped with MEMBERSET → no unnecessary periods/entities.

Pinned lookups ([dim]=#) → 1:1 RESULTLOOKUP, no fan-out.

NOT ISNULL(...) guards → skip rows with missing dates.

No loops needed for typical sizes; add more MEMBERSETs if the model is large.

 

Let me know how it goes?

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: MDK style is not applying to iOS app

entry.title: Potential Solution for Automatic Enrollment of Reimbursement-Type Benefits in SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
The SAP SuccessFactors Benefits module does not currently support automatic enrollment for reimbursement or claim-based benefits. This limitation poses a challenge for organizations—particularly in the Middle East—where expatriate employees are entitled to annual airfare or travel allowances at beginning of each year that require automation.

In this blog, I’ll walk through a solution design to automate the reimbursement/claim-type benefit using the Allowance benefit type and Integration Center, with an example of Air Ticket Entitlement for expats.

Business Scenario

  • Region: Middle East

  • Entitlement: Annual airfare amount for expatriates

  • Eligibility:

    • Posted at the start of the year as a one-time payment (Spot Bonus portlet)

    • Employees who join mid-year → entitlement only after probation completion

    • Amount is prorated for mid-year joiners

    • Amount varies by pay grade, legal entity, employee group (configurable via MDF lookup table)

Challenge:
Reimbursement-type benefits don’t support Automatic Enrollment in SuccessFactors, which makes it difficult to automate this business case.

Step 1: Configure Benefit Type

  • Create a benefit type as Allowance (instead of Reimbursement).

  • Set Payroll Integration Mode = Benefit Objects.

  • Use MDF Objects (lookup tables) to map entitlement amount variations (grade, entity, grouping).

  • Maintain eligibility rules (probation, grouping, etc.).

Step 2: Automate Posting to One-Time Payments

  • Use Integration Center job to fetch entitlement amount from Benefit Enrollment Object.

  • Post the entitlement amount into Pay Component Non-Recurring (Spot Bonus portlet) automatically.

Basic Configuration steps:

Source Entity: BenefitEnrollment

Target Entity: EmpPayCompNonRecurring (Spot Bonus portlet)

Integration Format: ODATA V2

Execution Schedule: Daily (to catch new enrollments and probation completions)

Key Mappings:

  • BenefitEnrollment.id → sequenceNumber

  • BenefitEnrollment.workerId → userId

  • EffectiveStartDate → payDate

  • Enrollment Amount → value

  • CurrencyCode → currencyCode

  • 9999 (hard-coded Pay Component Code) → payComponentCode

Step 3: End Result

Once the Integration Center job runs, the entitlement is automatically created in the employee’s Pay Component Non-Recurring (Spot Bonus) portlet.

As shown in the screenshot below, the Air Ticket Entitlement has been successfully posted with the correct: Time Period, Entitlement Amount, Currency, Issue Date, Sequence Number.

This ensures that:

  • HR/Payroll teams don’t need to manually enter the allowance.

  • Entitlements are consistent with eligibility rules (probation, proration, grouping).

  • The process is fully automated and auditable.

Read other SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central blog posts and follow  SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

Please follow my profile for future posts narain42

It would be appreciated if you could Like and Share your valuable feedback in the comment section.

entry.title: Re: Creating a URL to connect a dashboard to an Order in...
entry.content:
Hello @Lyzmarcadus 

Yes, it is possible to create a direct link from your dashboard to a specific order in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This allows users to access and edit the order immediately, without the need to manually copy and paste the order number.

To implement this, you can create a deep link that directly points to the specific order in the SAP Fiori launchpad. Users simply click the link from your dashboard and are taken straight to the order, as long as they have the necessary access rights.

For comprehensive guidance on deep linking and app integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, please consult the official SAP documentation here:
Manual Integration of Apps and Deep Linking in SAP Build Work Zone
https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-advanced-edition/sap-build-work-zone-advanced-edition/manual-integration-of-apps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Request for Solution – Assigning Assets to Employees...
entry.content:
Hello @ahsanali 

There is no standard Personnel Number field to assign assets directly to employees in the asset master in S4HANA Public Cloud, as seen in your screenshot. This limitation results from the simplified standard design of the Public Cloud.

To monitor asset assignments to employees, you can utilise custom fields via the SAP Fiori  Custom Fields and Logic  app or consider developing extensions on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) for more advanced scenarios.

For more information on custom fields and enhancements, please consult the official SAP documentation.
Custom Fields and Logic in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-s4hcloud-procurement-po-customlogic-tracing..html

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F1481')/S35

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to Perform Multiple Asset Retirements in S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @SivaNagiReddy 

The Post Asset Retirement app only supports single-asset postings. A genuine mass retirement option is not provided in the standard.

For multiple assets, you have two supported approaches:

API-based: Utilise the Fixed Asset Post Asset Retirement API from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Each retirement is recorded asset by asset, but you can automate bulk processing by looping through multiple assets in middleware or custom integration.

No-code automation: Use SAP Build Process Automation to coordinate retirements without coding. BPA can activate the API or help automate the Post Asset Retirement app for multiple assets in a seamless way.

There is no direct “mass retirement” app, but you can achieve the requirement with API automation or BPA.

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

The Screen Maintenance Requests app does not display approval history. To monitor who approved or rejected a request, use the following.

  • Manage Workflow Instances – full workflow log with timestamps and decisions.

SAP Help – Manage Workflow Instances

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to track the person responsible or custodian of t...
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, there isn’t a standard Personnel Number field in the asset master, as there is in Private Cloud.

To track the employee responsible, such as a laptop assigned to an individual, the recommended approach is to add a custom custodian/employee field to the asset master using the Custom Fields and Logic app.

This field can then be utilised in apps and reports, and if you use SuccessFactors, it can be linked to employee master data.

Withn regards

Chums

entry.title: Enhancing Security in Identity Authentication Service (IAS) with Certificate-Based Authentication
entry.content:
🔐Enhancing Security in Identity Authentication Service (IAS) with Certificate-Based Authentication

✨“Moving beyond Client ID & Secret — strengthening IAS with certificate-based authentication for enterprise-grade security.”

About Me

Hare Krishna 🙏 I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect, sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

📘Introduction

In modern enterprise landscapes, Identity Authentication Service (IAS) plays a key role in securing access to applications and systems. Traditionally, system user authentication in IAS relied on Client ID and Secret (essentially a username and password mechanism). While simple to implement, it comes with inherent risks—🔑 password leakage and 🗄️ storage vulnerabilities.

To address these challenges, IAS provides the option to use certificate-based authentication, offering a stronger and more secure alternative.

 

 

 

 

 

 

⚠️Limitations of Client ID & Secret Authentication

Although widely used, Client ID and Secret authentication has drawbacks:

  • 🔑Password-like storage: Secrets need to be securely stored, often in encrypted vaults.

  • 🚨Leakage risk: Exposure in logs, code repositories, or integrations can compromise the system.

🛡️ Why Certificate-Based Authentication?

Certificate-based authentication strengthens IAS security by replacing secrets with a cryptographic key pair.

  • 🔒Stronger Security: Asymmetric encryption makes brute-force attacks impractical.

  • 🗝️ No password dependency: Eliminates risks tied to weak or reused passwords.

  • 🛑Leakage-resistant: Public certificate exposure is harmless without the private key.

⚙️How It Works in IAS

  1. 👤System User Creation: Generate a certificate instead of a Client ID and Secret.

  2. 🔑Public-Private Key Pair:

    • The public certificate is uploaded to IAS.

    • The private key remains with the consuming application.

  3. 🔍Authentication: IAS validates the presented certificate.

  4. ✅Access Granted: Secure communication is established.

🔗Real-World Use Cases for Certificate-Based Authentication

So when should you consider using certificate-based authentication in IAS?

This approach is particularly beneficial when:

  • 🌐You need to establish API-based connectivity with IAS from external tools or applications.

  • 🔧A system user is required for integrations, automations, or monitoring purposes.

  • 🛡️ You want to secure machine-to-machine (M2M) communication more efficiently than with Client ID & Secret.

In such scenarios, certificates ensure stronger trust and reduce credential management risks, making them ideal for enterprise-grade integrations.

🖼️ Real-Life Example: Configuring Certificate-Based Authentication in IAS

📂Understanding Certificate Formats Before You Begin

Before we jump into the actual configuration, it’s important to understand the different certificate file formats you may encounter during the process. This helps avoid confusion when handling files like .p12, .crt, and .pem.

✅Key Differences at a Glance

Format Contains Private Key? Contains Cert(s)? Encoding Typical Use
.crt❌No✅YesBase64 (PEM) or Binary (DER)Server certificate file
.pem✅Optional✅YesBase64 (PEM)Flexible container for certs/keys
.p12 / .pfx✅Yes✅Yes (can include full chain)Binary (PKCS#12)Import/export in apps, keystores

🔑Practical Flow in IAS Scenario

  • You generate a .p12 (PKCS#12) file → this includes both your private key and certificate chain.

  • From this .p12, you typically extract:

    • Private Key → required for secure client authentication.

    • Full Certificate Chain (.crt/.pem) → ensures trust and proper verification.

👉By understanding this, you’ll know what each file is for and why it’s being used in SAP IAS certificate-based authentication.

Step by Step instructions to perform the activity

Generate .p12 → extract private key (.pem) → extract full certificate chain (.crt/.pem) → upload public cert/chain to IAS (system user) → store private key securely in your app → enable client-certificate auth → test the API connectivity.

Login to IAS, Click on Administrators and create System User with required privileges

Click on Certificate

Provide CN name and password for certificate and click on generate - it will create a .p12 file

Save it.

Open Terminal and enter command (here API_Cert.p12 is the certificate name downloaded from IAS). Post this enter the required fields like passphrase etc.

openssl pkcs12 -in API_Cert.p12 -info

It will have private key and Full chain certificate, Copy the Private key in a text file and save it as .pem file

similarly copy the full chain certificate in a text file and save it as .pem

Upload the full chain certificate in IAS and save it.

Certificate is successfully uploaded in IAS

Let's test it using POSTMAN. Open Postman and go to settings -> Add certificate -> upload the certificate as shown below and provide URL of IAS and password

Perform a get operation to check if connectivity is working fine. You should receive 200 success message like shown below

📝Best Practices for Certificate-Based Authentication in IAS

  • 📆Track certificate validity: Default validity is 1 year — plan renewals in advance.

  • 🗄️ Secure private keys: Store them in HSMs or trusted key vaults.

  • 🔄Automate renewal: Prevent downtime due to expired certificates.

  • 📊Monitor usage: Continuously audit authentication logs in IAS.

🎯Conclusion

Switching from Client ID & Secret to certificate-based authentication in IAS is a major security enhancement. It reduces password-related risks, strengthens trust between systems, and ensures compliance.

By adopting certificates, enterprises can align IAS with modern security standards, making their environment more secure, resilient, and future-ready 🚀.

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Product Compliance - Colla...
entry.content:
Hello @jan_morskate 

Currently, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition does not support the Campaign feature used in Private Cloud for gathering compliance information from suppliers. Public Cloud provides strong product compliance tools, such as SDS and dangerous goods management, but campaigns are not supported.

You can achieve a similar result by using SAP Business Network to include compliance questionnaires in procurement, or by creating a custom BTP-based campaign app that emails suppliers and inputs responses into S/4. Let me know if you'd like assistance in designing one.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: S/4 Public cloud - Service - repair in house subcontr...
entry.content:
Hello @Laure_AD 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, subcontracting is not part of the in-house repair process. The repair is managed with scope item 3XK In-House Repair, while any external work is handled through Service Procurement with a Service Entry Sheet.

If you want to keep track of logistics, outbound and inbound deliveries are available for sending and receiving the customer’s equipment.

SAP Documentation  SAP Learning -In-House Repair (3XK)  and Purchase Requisitions for Purchaser

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to integrate Power BI with S/4HANA Clo...
entry.content:
Hi,

 

For a customer, we were able to connect SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud (RISE with SAP) to Power BI using ODBC connectors.

We raised a service request to SAP & asked them to install ODBC drivers for SAP Database & create a user that can be used while connecting to Power BI in the logon screen as seen in the below URL. 

Refer below blog for more details.

Power Query SAP HANA database connector - Power Query | Microsoft Learn

 

Since there are a lot of licensing changes happening in SAP Private Cloud, you can check with SAP team if there is any new license to be procured for connectors.


Regards,

Gavin.

entry.title: IPアドレス変更時のRFC宛先設定変更について
entry.content:
Solmanサーバ、ERPサーバ、SAPRouterサーバについてIPアドレスが変更となり、
後述のRFC宛先についてIPアドレスが設定されているため、トランザクションコードSM59で変更しようとしております。
それぞれ括弧内に記載したユーザ（「Logonとセキュリティ」タブに登録されているユーザ）のパスワード欄に何を入力すればよいのか教えていただけませんでしょうか。
具体的な値や確認方法、もしくは作成し直す場合はその手順を教えていただきたく、よろしくお願い致します。

RFCs for SAP communication: SAP-OSS, SAP-OSS-LIST-O01


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: IPアドレス変更時のRFC宛先設定変更について
entry.content:
2020/5/29から、RFCの接続（SAPOSSやSDCC_OSS）よりSAPバックエンドと通信できないことなりました。
直接にSAPへデータ送信するために、Checklistsのステップに従い、HTTPSの宛先を利用する必要がございます。技術通信ユーザの登録も必要でございます。

詳細情報につきまして、以下をご参照ください。
2923799 - Final Shutdown of RFC Connections From Customer Systems to SAP
2740667 - SAP is going to close its proprietary RFC communication for automated data exchange between Customers & SAP Support Backbone (SAPOSS) by July 2020
--------------------------------
If you still have systems connecting to SAP Support backbone using RFC channels, you must now migrate to SAP’s new HTTPS-based Support Backbone infrastructure
by following the instructions provided in our Support Backbone Guide and Checklists without further delay.
-----------------------------------

entry.title: Clarification on Project Validation BAdI (Enterprise Project) – Feasibility of External API Call
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are currently testing part of a customer requirement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. The ultimate goal of this implementation is to trigger an API call to an external system in order to provide notifications whenever an Enterprise Project is created or released.

Since this request comes from a potential customer evaluation, a clear answer is critical and time-sensitive. We would therefore highly appreciate your guidance at the earliest possible time.

For this purpose, we are analyzing the Business Add-In (BAdI) in the Project Structure (PPM-SCL-STR) component, specifically the Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI. Reference: Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI. During our evaluation, we identified three main points for clarification:

1. BAdI Release Status for Developer Extensibility

  • The Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI is currently released only for Key User Extensibility and is not released for Developer Extensibility.

  • We would like to confirm whether it is possible to request SAP to release this BAdI for Developer Extensibility as well.

  • From our understanding, such requests must be submitted through the SAP Customer Influence program, but this does not guarantee approval and the process may take significant time. Could you please confirm whether there are any other alternatives available in the meantime?

2. Feasibility of External POST Call from Custom Logic

  • If enabling Developer Extensibility is not feasible in the short term, we would like to know whether it is technically possible to perform an HTTP POST call directly from the Custom Logic implementation of this BAdI.

  • We have already created the Communication Scenario and Outbound Service in ADT, and the Communication System and Communication Arrangement in the tenant are configured correctly.

  • Our main question is whether outbound communication is permitted from Custom Logic, and if so, we kindly request sample code or reference documentation to validate the approach.

3. Reference Case – Purchase Requisition BAdI

As a reference, we reviewed the Check of Purchase Requisition Item BAdI, which is released for both Key User Extensibility and Developer Extensibility. Reference: Check of Purchase Requisition Item BAdI.

  • In this case, it seems possible to implement outbound API calls using ADT with Developer Extensibility. Could you please confirm whether our assumption is correct?

  • Additionally, once the Project Validation – Enterprise Project BAdI is released for Developer Extensibility, would a similar outbound communication approach be feasible?


SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ABAP Extensibility

Thanks,

entry.title: Re: How to Disable Status "preliminary import requested"...
entry.content:
Hi,

Regarding your requirement, in standard SMMJ, step 5,6,7,8 are bound together for preliminary import scenario, see below document for more details:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Solution_Manager/8b923a2175be4939816f0981b73856c7/d6e6bcc740964311987d440ab83e6684.html

If you don't want to see step 5,6,7, but just leave step8, we don't have that in standard, you need to involve consulting service to help further.

But if you want to remove the whole step 5,6,7,8, then you could follow below KBAs to do the reverse. But we don't recommend to do that from our side:

KBA: 0002500852 - ChaRM Customizing: Inserting New User Status

KBA: 0003103731 - How to work with Action Definition and Action Conditions

Once you remove all the definitions(user statuses, actions/conditions) of preliminary import(step 5,6,7,8), you will not see step 5,6,7,8 in the status overview.

Hope these clarify and help.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Add Z Fields in 'User Data Tab' of tx. CJ01 / CJ02 /...
entry.content:
Not sure, whether you already tried in SPRO → Project System → Structures → Operative Structures → Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) → User Interface Settings → Create User-Defined Fields for WBS Elements
If not, you can add the required fields to PROJ table via SE11 and make it workable, use EXIT_SAPLCJWB_002 and EXIT_SAPLCJWB_003

entry.title: Re: Function Module Product_List_Exclusion does not consi...
entry.content: Even if valid condition records exist in the listing procedure, the FM may not return results unless specific material data is passed in the item structure. What you can try is include at least one material number (MATNR) that you want to check. Also, include the relevant sales org, distribution channel, and customer in the header. Ensure the scheme matches the one configured in your condition records.

entry.title: Revoking of Withholding Tax Rounding Off Rule
entry.content:
Hi,

We have enabled the Rounding off rule for the Withholding Tax Type for all our Company Codes since April 2024.

Now, it has been decided to revoke this rounding-off rule for all company codes.

Kindly advise whether there will be any issue in revoking the rounding off rule in the middle of the financial year DIGITS-26, and its impact on entries that were posted already in earlier periods and the fiscal year.

entry.title: Re: Mexico DIOT report issue in Public Cloud Fiori
entry.content:
Hi everyone, I got the response from SAP.

Hello Customer,

SAP will delivery those adjustments to your system (Including the business types) in a future release.

As for now, it's not possible to insert it manually on the system. Development team is currently working on this delivery, but currently we don't have an estimated date.
As a workaround, please adjust the Business Type (and other new necessary entries) manually on the txt result from the current layout (20 positions).

entry.title: Re: KP26 create but info not update in COST
entry.content:
Ensure the activity type has a valid cost element assigned in KL01/KL02. The cost element should be of category 43 (internal activity allocation).
KP26 uses planning version (typically version 0). Check that the fiscal year and periods match your planning horizon.
Even after changes, old control records in tables like CSSL may interfere. Not sure, in which version you are working but you can check SAP Note 129584 for more information. May be you can run the report RKPLNC29 to clean up residual planning data.

entry.title: Re: Production Order Split
entry.content:
Hi ND,

Base on your requirement you can check the BAdIs on Production Operation (Execution and Control) area on Online Help: Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Key User Extensibility | SAP Help Portal.

For example, the split function is on production order operation level, you may check the BAdI: BD_COBADICFL_MFGORDER_OPR_INIT and BD_COBADICFL_MFGORDER_OPR.

entry.title: Re: Add Z Fields in 'User Data Tab' of tx. CJ01 / CJ02 /...

entry.title: Re: Revoking of Withholding Tax Rounding Off Rule
entry.content:
Yes, you can revoke the rounding-off rule for Withholding Tax Type mid-year, but you need to take into considerations the below points:

  • SAP calculates WHT based on the rule active at the time of posting. Changing the rule does not retroactively adjust previously posted entries.
  • Entries posted before April 2024 used rounding (e.g., ₹100.55 → ₹101). Entries after revocation will reflect exact calculated amounts (e.g., ₹100.55 stays ₹100.55). This may lead to minor discrepancies in reporting, reconciliation, or audit trails.
  • Reports like FBL1N, FBL3N, or tax registers may show inconsistent WHT values across periods.
  • Reversing old entries and reposting them after rule change may result in different WHT amounts. This could affect vendor balances or tax liability calculations.

entry.title: Re: Python support in CAP based Application
entry.content:
While CAP has been designed for Node.js and Java, you can absolutely use Python on BTP.  All 3 runtimes: Cloud Foundry, Kyma and SAP AI core allow you to deploy python apps and they can integrate very well with your CAP applications at the API layer. And now of course you can make use of SAP Databricks to host ML workloads as well.

"AI experts" will typically use python notebooks for exploratory data analysis and building machine learning models and you can do this with the Business Application Studio.

You can use the python package hana-ml to make use of the machine learning capabilities built right into hana or whatever favourite ML frameworks (scikit-learn, pytorch, langchain, openai) you like and then serve them with an api endpoint in cloud foundry kyma or ai core to be used by your CAP app.

If you are thinking more about LLM's - you can already integrate them into your cap apps quite easily using APIs and the helper SDK's that SAP provides like https://sap.github.io/ai-sdk/, without needing python.

 

And now of course with the partnership with Databricks and SAP Business Data Cloud you can create your notebooks in Databricks as well for an out of the box feature set.

entry.title: Re: Add a new field in S/4 Material master and EWM produc...
entry.content:
Though it is possible the steps are many, involving both technical and functional.

Step 1: Add the New Field to Material Master in S/4HANA

1.1. Define the Field in the Data Dictionary

  • Go to SE11.
  • Create or enhance the structure:
    • For basic data: MARA
    • For plant-specific data: MARC
    • For storage location data: MAKT, etc.
  • Add your custom field (e.g., ZZFIELD_NAME) with appropriate data type.

1.2. Enhance the Screen Using Transaction CMOD

  • Use CMOD to enhance the material master screens.
  • Use the enhancement project: SAPLXMARA.
  • Implement the user exit: EXIT_SAPLMGMU_001 (for screen enhancements).
  • Add your field to the screen using a subscreen.

1.3. Update the Field in the Database

  • Implement logic in:
    • EXIT_SAPLMGMU_002 – for data transfer from screen to internal table.
    • EXIT_SAPLMGMU_003 – for data transfer from internal table to screen.

1.4. Maintain Field in Field Selection Group

  • Go to SPRO → Logistics General → Material Master → Field Selection → Assign Fields to Field Selection Groups.
  • Assign your new field to a group so it appears in the UI.

Step 2: Propagate the Field to EWM

2.1. Check Integration Method

  • If you're using CIF (Core Interface) or DRF (Data Replication Framework), you need to ensure the field is included in the replication model.

2.2. Extend the Structure for CIF/DRF

  • For CIF: Extend structure CIFMAT01 or relevant BAdI.
  • For DRF: Use transaction DRFOUT and extend the relevant data model (e.g., MATMAS).

2.3. Enhance the Mapping Logic

  • Use BAdIs like:
    • BADI_CIFMAT (for CIF)
    • BADI_DRF_OUTBOUND (for DRF)
  • Map your custom field from S/4 to the EWM structure.

2.4. Enhance EWM Side

  • In EWM (usually on a decentralized system), extend the material master structure.
  • Use transaction EEWB or SE11 to add the field.
  • Enhance the UI and logic to use the new field.

Step 3: Test the End-to-End Flow

  1. Create or change a material in S/4HANA.
  2. Ensure the new field is visible and editable.
  3. Trigger replication to EWM.
  4. Verify the field is received and stored correctly in EWM.

entry.title: Re: Add Z Fields in 'User Data Tab' of tx. CJ01 / CJ02 /...
entry.content:
To place the input fields, SAP already provides fields like USR00, USR01, etc. in the PROJ table for customer use.

To make them visible in the “User Data” tab, go to SPRO → Project System → Structures → Operative Structures → Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) → User Interface Settings → Create User-Defined Fields for WBS Elements. Assign the PROJ-USRxx fields to the screen layout. Choose the screen group and assign the fields to the “User Data” tab.

To label the fields, in the same SPRO path, you can assign labels to each USR field. These labels will appear as field descriptions in the UI. You can also use screen painter (SE51) if you want more control over layout and grouping.

Use the enhancement CJWB0001, which includes:

Inside these exits, map screen fields to PROJ-USRxx, Validate or transform input if needed. Ensure data is saved to the database correctly.

entry.title: Re: 3 more videos on integrating SAP Build Apps with DMS
entry.content:
I don't think DMS was ever available in trial. Integration Option is available in free tier.

Document AI seems to be a new name for Document Extraction, uploading a document and extract the information inside it. DMS is just about having a repository for your documents.

entry.title: Re: Python support in CAP based Application
entry.content: We would need someone from the CAP team to comment on that but personally I highly doubt it and do not see any benefit in CAP natively supporting Python. CAP is an awesome application & db layer technology and can work with any type of ML or AI. Python notebooks are the place for data analysis, exploration and training ml models.

entry.title: Re: How to Approve/Reject Task via API in SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
@nayak_aj There is an API under Workflow Definitions to retrieve the "model" of a workflow.

I created a custom button along with the standard submit button. The button's display name is CustomButton and its identifier is button1. 

If I run the model API for this process, in part I get this, where I can see the display name and the identifier of the button.

Is that what you needed?

P.S.: Sorry for the delay in responding 😸

entry.title: Re: Issue with a simple FMS
entry.content: Hi Chris, This worked for me: Declare @Percnt numeric(18,6) =$[$38.U_Tariff.number] Declare @Rate numeric(18,6)=$[$38.14.number] SELECT convert(numeric(18,6),@Rate) * convert(numeric(18,6),(@Percnt/100)) Regards, Joseph

entry.title: Re: Clean Core Index
entry.content:
Hi @Ryan-Crosby 

thanks for your comment. You got a point about reports (especially missing ownership) and we really need to get rid of them. Replacing each single report with a successor (Fiori App + RAP) will block all our development resources for the next years. We wouldn't be able to fulfil any new requirement during this period. That's what I mean with high effort but no cost savings.
Once we fixed the most important issue with modifications, reports will become the main part of our Clean Core Index.

entry.title: Re: Not able to subscribe integration suite in SAP BTP ac...
entry.content: To my knowledge, the supported Regions for SAP Integration Suite Trial are Europe, US East & Singapore. Not all regions support Integration Suite in trial mode. If you choose an unsupported region, the subscription will fail.

entry.title: Re: How to get single property from a nested structure using $select in Odata API Call
entry.content:
Hi Marco, Chaouki

Thanks for your replies. I have already tried both the options, but it is not working

1) /sap/opu/odata/sap/FAR_BS_ITM_REPROC_SRV/FinsPostingBSItemDspHeaders(BankStatementShortId='2711',BankStatementItem='1')?sap-client=200&$select=BSItem/ApplicationLogHandle&$format=json

2) /sap/opu/odata/sap/FAR_BS_ITM_REPROC_SRV/FinsPostingBSItemDspHeaders(BankStatementShortId='2711',BankStatementItem='1')?sap-client=200&$select=BSItem($select=ApplicationLogHandle)&$format=json

Both these options are not working. I have not missed any $ sign. 

I must say, reading the entire BSItem structure works using $select. 

e.g. /sap/opu/odata/sap/FAR_BS_ITM_REPROC_SRV/FinsPostingBSItemDspHeaders(BankStatementShortId='2711',BankStatementItem='1')?sap-client=200&$select=BSItem&$format=json

I am interested to read 1 property from BSItem entity. 

Regards

Sandip
